page.title: 01Great Fryup Dale and Area
page.content: A block situated in the middle of moorland but disected by three valleys tributaries of the Esk, so much of it is lower than the surroundings moors and devoted to farming. The main valley, Great Fry up Dale is mainly devoted to sheep and cattle grazing and the few residents live in a scattering of farms as there are no real villages. There are some woodlands just below the moorlands start and the only activities on the moors are rough sheep grazing and perhaps grouse shooting. The Esk valley is very popular with tourists and Great FryUp Dale, and Glaisdale in particular get quite a few visitors. Many people find the scenery particularly attractive for walking. The area is easily accessible by road from Eskdale and from the south.
